Perfect Gift for Pokémon Enthusiasts: Delight a Pokémon fan with this thoughtfully curated Pokémon card pack. Featuring authentic Japanese Pokémon cards, it pairs perfectly with any Pokémon card binder or Pokémon premium collection box, making it an ideal gift for any collector.
description: Product Description Pokemon Trading Card Booster Packs by TCYM TCYM: Authentic Pokemon Cards from around the world! TCYM is dedicated to providing collectors with genuine, untampered Pokémon cards sourced directly from trusted suppliers in Japan, Korea, and the UK. Every pack and box is carefully inspected to ensure pristine condition and authenticity, giving customers confidence in their purchase. With TCYM’s branded seal of quality, collectors can trust they’re receiving products handled with care and integrity. Card Rarities Art Rare A full-art card from the Ancient Roar set, featuring Pokémon in imaginative and vibrant scenes that highlight their personalities and habitats. Art Rare's in this set use expressive artwork and rich backgrounds—like Crustle huddling in a cave or Veluza swimming among coral—to create visually striking moments that stand out from standard cards. Special Art Rare A highly detailed, cinematic card from Ancient Roar, showcasing dramatic scenes with Pokémon or key characters such as Professor Sada. Special Art Rare's feature intricate backgrounds, dynamic poses, and storytelling—like Roaring Moon ex soaring through a vortex of coloured light or Professor Sada deep in research—making these cards the artistic highlights and centerpieces of the set. Art Rare A full-art card from the Future Flash set, featuring Pokémon in imaginative, futuristic scenes that highlight their personalities and environments. Art Rare's showcase expressive artwork and vibrant colours—like Swablu among a flock of Wingull—bringing each moment to life with unique storytelling and visual flair. Special Art Rare A highly detailed, cinematic card from Future Flash, depicting dramatic moments or evolving stories with Pokémon or key characters. Special Art Rare's, such as Altaria ex soaring with its Wingull family, feature intricate backgrounds and dynamic compositions, making them true centerpieces that capture the innovative spirit of the set. 3 x Pokemon Paradox Rift Booster Packs | Scarlet & Violet Set | Pokémon Tradi... Buying Options Add To Basket Buying Options Buying Options Buying Options Customer Reviews — 3.5 out of 5 stars 2 — — — Price — no data £69.99 £ 69 . 99 — no data — no data — no data Language English Japanese Japanese no data no data Quantity of Packs 3 Packs 30 Packs 3 Packs 30 Packs 3 Packs English Card Packs ✓ no data no data no data no data Cards Per Pack 10 Cards 5 Cards 5 Cards 5 Cards 5 Cards Authentic Pokemon Product ✓ ✓ ✓ no data no data What are the difference between Japanese, Korean and English Pokemon Cards UK Pokémon Cards UK Pokémon cards are printed in English and are functionally identical to other international English-language cards, making them fully compatible for gameplay worldwide. While the core design, card backs, and set structure match those found in the US and other English-speaking regions, UK cards may occasionally feature region-specific promotional releases or special editions. For collectors, subtle differences in distribution, availability, and exclusive promos can influence the desirability and market value of UK cards compared to their international counterparts. Japanese Pokémon Cards Japanese Pokémon cards are renowned for their high print quality, glossy finish, and unique card backs that set them apart from international versions. They often feature exclusive artwork, special holofoil effects, and a wider range of rarities, such as Art Rares and Special Art Rares, which may not be available in English or Korean sets. Japanese sets are typically released earlier than their international counterparts, and certain cards—especially promos and limited editions—are only available in Japan, making them highly sought after by collectors worldwide. The use of Japanese language and distinct design elements adds to their authenticity and appeal for fans of the original Pokémon TCG experience. Korean Pokémon Cards Korean Pokémon cards offer a unique blend of features from both Japanese and English releases. They use Hangul script for card text and often combine cards from multiple Japanese or English sets within a single Korean set. Notably, Korean cards have historically used the English-style blue card back, but as of the Scarlet & Violet era, they now feature the Japanese-style silver borders. The card stock and holo patterns can differ slightly from Japanese and English cards, and Korean sets are generally more affordable, making them popular among collectors seeking variety and value. Some exclusive promos and unique set compositions further distinguish Korean cards in the global market. TCYM Authenticated Pokemon Products The Importance of TCYM Authentication for Pokémon Cards To ensure the integrity of our products, TCYM sources Pokémon cards directly from reputable suppliers. By working with trusted partners across the globe, we eliminate risks associated with secondary markets or unauthorized sellers. Our direct sourcing approach includes: Osaka, Japan : Japan is home to some of the most exclusive trading card shops. We source Japanese Pokémon cards directly from a trusted shop in Osaka to ensure authenticity and secure handling. Seoul, Korea : South Korea’s official distributors provide us with Korean-language Pokémon products. By sourcing directly from these distributors in Seoul, we ensure that every pack or box is untampered. United Kingdom : For English-language Pokémon cards, we purchase exclusively through official UK distribution channels. This direct relationship ensures that all products arrive sealed and in excellent condition. Once shipments arrive at TCYM from our trusted suppliers, every booster pack, box set, or promotional item undergoes a rigorous inspection process focused on verifying its condition and ensuring it has not been tampered with. Our inspection process includes: Seal Integrity : We check that all seals on booster packs and boxes are intact and have not been resealed or compromised. Packaging Condition : Boxes are inspected for dents, tears, scratches, or other damage that could affect their collectible value. Authenticity Verification : While ensuring great condition is our priority, we also confirm that each product is genuine by examining printing quality, holographic features, set symbols, and codes.
